problem_text:
11.51. Are there (large, non-trivial) classes X of torsion-free abelian groups such that for A, C ∈ X the group Ext (C, A) is torsion-free? It is a fact (E. L. Lady, A. Mader, J. Algebra, 140 (1991), 36–64) that two groups of such a class are nearly isomorphic if and only if they have equal p-ranks for all p.
A. Mader
